etymology.interpretation: Depicts a person kneeling in profile, with the bent leg and foot suggested by the hooked strokes. It later serves as the ‘kneel/seal’ component in other characters.

examples.chinese: 在甲骨文里(在甲骨文裡)，卪表示跪着的人(卪表示跪著的人)。
examples.pinyin: Zài jiǎgǔwén lǐ, jié biǎoshì guìzhe de rén.
examples.english: In oracle bone script, 卪 represents a kneeling person.

examples.chinese: 这个字很少见(這個字很少見)，多用作部件(多用作部件)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège zì hěn shǎojiàn, duō yòngzuò bùjiàn.
examples.english: This character is rarely seen and is mostly used as a component.

examples.chinese: 写字时(寫字時)，别把卪和卩混淆(別把卪和卩混淆)。
examples.pinyin: Xiězì shí, bié bǎ jié hé jié hùnxiáo.
examples.english: When writing, don’t confuse 卪 with 卩.
